item.title: Report E-2025010042
item.description:
Report E-2025010042

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T18:25:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-05
  • City: SAN ANTONIO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0720 EST, XPO Logistics terminal LSX notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that due to improper loading, 1â€“3-gallon metal pail of UN1263, Masterpro refinishing General purpose lacquer thinner was damaged resulting in the release of 3 oz of product to the body of the pail. ERTS reviewed the SDS with XPO, who confirmed terminal personnel were comfortable and capable of cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per the SDS. The impacted pail was containerized into (1) 4-gallon metal drum.

item.title: Report E-2024120448
item.description:
Report E-2024120448

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-01T21:13:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-26
  • City: GARLAND
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 26, 2024, LGT notified ERTS of a spill that occurred inside of a trailer and on the dock in Garland, TX. The spill consisted of approximately half a quart of UN1824 Trupower All Purpose Dishmachine Detergent, which spilled from a box containing a 5-gallon plastic jug. The jug was damaged due to the shipper loading the box containing the jug too closely to another pallet, which punctured the container and caused it to leak out onto the trailer floor and on the dock as well. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who turned down contractor assistance. Terminal personnel donned PPE and contained and cleaned the release. The damaged jug and impacted absorbents were placed into a 10-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024120460
item.description:
Report E-2024120460

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-01T21:13:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-04
  • City: SAN ANTONIO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0640 EST, XPO Logistics terminal LSX notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported (1) 55-gallon metal drum of UN1993 Truegard Brake Clean Low VOC was located with 1 quart of product releasing to the trailer floor below. The cause of the release is currently unknown but could possibly be due to a nail puncture from the pallet. ERTS reviewed the SDS with James, who communicated with his SCM and advised they will attempt to overpack the drum themselves and will provide an update in about an hour if a team will be required. XPO did overpack the impacted drum and spent absorbents.
